pullRequest.body:
We show that a fiber functor of a Galois category is pro-represented by the system of pointed Galois objects. We also introduce the system of automorphism groups (seen as objects of `C`) of the pointed Galois objects.

This is used in a follow-up PR to establish a group isomorphism between the automorphism group of a fiber functor and the limit of the automorphism groups of the Galois objects.

---

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

nodes.body: Thanks for the fast review @joelriou! I adapted your suggestions.

Thanks!

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9077746574/job/24943302543)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9077746574/job/24943302283)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9077746574/job/24943303259)
I am ok for removing the `simp` attribute, but then I believe that you should add `simp` lemmas similar to `fiberBinaryProductEquiv_symm_fst_apply`.

```suggestion
noncomputable def fiberBinaryProductEquiv (X Y : C) :
    F.obj (X ⨯ Y) ≃ F.obj X × F.obj Y :=
  (PreservesLimitPair.iso (F ⋙ FintypeCat.incl) X Y ≪≫
    Types.binaryProductIso (F.obj X) (F.obj Y)).toEquiv
```
(I think that `fiberEqualizerEquiv` and `fiberPullbackEquiv` should be modified similarly.)

```suggestion
  apply evaluationInjective_of_isConnected F A Z (F.map f (Classical.arbitrary _))
  simpa using congr_fun (F.congr_map huv) _
```
Very neat!

```suggestion
lemma card_hom_le_card_fiber_of_connected (A X : C) [IsConnected A] :
```

```suggestion
lemma card_aut_le_card_fiber_of_connected (A : C) [IsConnected A] :
```
(There might be other names which should be changed accordingly.)

```suggestion
  apply Nat.card_le_card_of_injective
  exact evaluation_aut_injective_of_isConnected _ _ (Classical.arbitrary _)
```

The following syntax seems easier to read:
```suggestion
  cases f; cases g; congr
```

I later learned (from looking at one of your PRs) that I can put `@[ext]` on a structure, so I introduced a `hom_ext` instead which just uses the automatically generated one. Is that the preferred way?
Yes, any of these two options is good.

```suggestion
  comp : F.map val A.pt = B.pt := by simp

attribute [simp] Hom.comp

```

Making `Hom.comp` a simp lemma above makes this one redundant:
```suggestion
```

(We may occasionally want to use the `_assoc` version in the other direction.)
```suggestion
@[simp, reassoc]
```

```suggestion
    simp [hhz, hf, hg]
```

```suggestion
lemma incl_map {A B : PointedGaloisObject F} (f : A ⟶ B) : (incl F).map f = f.val :=
  rfl
```

```suggestion
      suffices h : F.map g (F.map f b) = F.map g a by simpa
```

This syntax allows to avoid `@` in many situations:
```suggestion
      IsFilteredOrEmpty.cocone_objs (C := (PointedGaloisObject F)ᵒᵖ)
        ⟨{ obj := A, pt := a}⟩ ⟨{obj := B, pt := b}⟩
```
Do not you mean the *colimit* of `X ⋙ coyoneda`?
Indeed, that's what I mean.

It seems to me that from your results, we could obtain the following lemma:
```lean
lemma exists_autMap {A B : C} (f : A ⟶ B) [IsGalois A] [IsGalois B] (σ : Aut A) :
    ∃! (τ : Aut B), f ≫ τ.hom = σ.hom ≫ f := by
  sorry
```
which would allow to define `autMap` without assuming that `A` and `B` are pointed, and without relying on a specific fiber functor (in the proof, we may use the fibre functor given by the `GaloisCategory` instance).
Nice observation! I did as you suggested and it seems to play out well.

There should be an equational lemma for `autMapMul` (a better name might be `autMapHom`?) in order to ease the definition of `autGaloisSystem`. Adding `@[simps]` or `@[simps apply]`? may give the correct lemma.
`@[simps!]` worked.
